abstract: Various investigations and inquiries involving JPMorgan seem to be tangential to its business, and are being fed piecemeal through the news media to the detriment of the bank, the author writes.
snippet: Various investigations and inquiries involving JPMorgan seem to be tangential to its business, and are being fed piecemeal through the news media to the detriment of the bank, the author writes.
lead_paragraph: Richard E. Farley is a partner in the leveraged finance group of the law firm of Paul Hastings. He is writing a book titled “The Crisis Not Wasted: The Creation of Modern Financial Regulation During F.D.R.’s First Five Hundred Days,” a book on the creation of modern financial regulation during President Franklin Roosevelt’s first term of office.

headline.main: Confronting Regulators on the JPMorgan Leaks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
